unit_learning_outcomes.description: Synthesize and analyse information from a variety of sources
Demonstrate an advanced knowledge of research principles and methods
Articulate clearly a coherent argument in written, oral or technical communication as relevant to the specific activity chosen
Demonstrate advanced knowledge of the principles and concepts within the discipline

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to MGeoSc or MScInnovationGeologyGeophys or GradDipGeoSc

assessments.description: With your supervisor develop a learning plan for the unit including assessment tasks and total time to be spent on the tasks.

Supervisor and student to determine Assessment Tasks and weightings for project based units OR as listed in unit guides where components of other units are being undertaken; and approved by the Unit convenor. Minimum 3 tasks required, with a maximum of 60% weighting for any one task. Tasks can vary and may include a scientific report, report, essay or exam, as appropriate for a 10cp unit.

relationships.academic_item_name: Research Topics in Earth and Environmental Sciences

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: GEOS8811 - Research Topics in Earth and Environmental Sciences

academic_org.value: Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences

data.description: This unit comprises study of special topics in Earth and Environmental Sciences and is designed to supplement a student’s existing knowledge and coursework with targeted material and techniques that will be required for their on-going Masters units. Activities may include attending a national or international summer school, cross-institutional study or highly tailored units of study that are exemplars of current analytical/theoretical concepts or problem-solving applications of Earth and Environmental Sciences research methods. Topics and activities are selected with an academic advisor to encourage students to explore emerging themes in Earth and Environmental Sciences. Students develop skills in investigation and deep analysis required to undertake more advanced research.
